math_problem:
Find all functions $f$ $:$ $\mathbb{R} \rightarrow \mathbb{R}$  such that $\forall x,y \in \mathbb{R}$ :
$$(f(x)+y)(f(y)+x)=f(x^2)+f(y^2)+2f(xy)$$ Instead of finding all functions satisfying the given functional equation, simply find $m = c + 1$, where $c$ is the value of $f(1)$ for any function $f$ satisfying the equation. Find all functions $f:\mathbb Z^+\to\mathbb R^+$ that satisfy $f(nk^m)=f(n)f^2(k)$ for all positive integers $n$ and $k$, furthermore $\lim\limits_{n\to\infty}\dfrac{f(n+1)}{f(n)}=1$.
